verses.roman:
deva-dundubhayo nedur
gandharvāpsaraso jaguḥ
vavṛṣuḥ puṣpa-varṣāṇi
vibudhāḥ sādhu-vādinaḥ

synonyms: deva—of the demigods; dundubhayaḥ—the kettledrums; neduḥ—resounded; gandharva-apsarasaḥ—the Gandharvas and Apsarās; jaguḥ—sang; vavṛṣuḥ—they showered down; puṣpa-varṣāṇi—rains of flowers; vibudhāḥ—the demigods; sādhu-vādinaḥ—speaking praise.
translation: Kettledrums sounded in the regions of the demigods, and the celestial Gandharvas and Apsarās sang. The demigods showered flowers and spoke words of praise.

purport.content: Although lamenting at first, all learned persons, including the demigods, soon realized that a great soul had gone back home, back to Godhead. This was certainly a cause for celebration.
